content: परिणत {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} Bent or bowed down, stooping; <ls>Me. 2.</ls> {@--2@} Declining, old (as age); परिणते वयसि <ls>K. 35</ls>, <ls n="K.">62</ls>, <ls n="K.">63.</ls> {@--3@} Ripe, matured, ripened, fully developed or formed; श ब्दब्रह्मविदः कवेः परिणतप्रज्ञस्य वाणीमिमां <ls>U. 7. 21</ls>; <ls n="U.">1. 39</ls>, <ls n="U.">6. 13</ls>; <ls>Me. 23</ls>; परिणतमकरंदमार्मिकास्ते <ls>Bv. 1. 8</ls>; <ls>Śi. 11. 49.</ls> {@--4@} Full-grown, advanced, perfected; परिणतशरच्चद्रंक्रिरणैः <ls>Bh. 3. 49</ls>; <ls>Me. 110.</ls> {@--5@} Digested (as food). {@--6@} Transformed or changed into (with <ab>instr.</ab>); <ls>V. 4. 28.</ls> {@--7@} Ended, come to a close, terminated. {@--8@} Set (as the sun); <ls>Ś. 1. 32.</ls> --तः An elephant stooping to strike with his tusks, or giving a side-blow with his tusks; (तिर्यग्दंतप्रहारश्च गजः परिणतो मतः <ls>Halāy.</ls>); <ls>Śi. 4. 29</ls>; <ls>Ki. 6. 7.</ls>
